googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Georgia driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: You must provide your full GA Drivers License number or GA State issued ID number. If you do not have a GA Drivers License or GA ID you must provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security number.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Georgia voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Elections Division  
Office of the Secretary of State  
2 Martin Luther King Jr. Drive  
Suite 802 Floyd West Tower  
Atlanta, GA 30334
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Georgia voters must show a non-expired photo ID issued by any state or federal agency.  Examples of acceptable ID include a driver's license from any state; a non-driver's ID card from any state; a US passport; a US military photo ID; a tribal ID card. You can also show a student ID card issued by any Georgia public college, university, or technical school.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: The Local Election Office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges:
* In September 2020, a Georgia US distirct Court ruled that Georgia mail-in ballots will be considered timely if they are postmarked by Election Day (as opposed to received by election day).
* Counties are now allowed to use absentee ballot drop-boxes. Each county will decide if they will use drop-boxes.
* Georgia voters can request a mail-in ballot online as of August 2020.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You do not have to register with a party to take part in that party’s primary, caucus or convention.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need a valid GA driver’s license or GA identification card in order to use Georgia’s online voter registration system. If you do not have this, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox8: This information is requested but not required.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Georgia voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Georgia you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a legal resident of Georgia and of the county in which you want to vote
  * be 18 years old within six months after the day of registration, and be 18 years old to vote
  * not be serving a sentence for having been convicted of a felony involving moral turpitude
  * not have been judicially determined to be mentally incompetent, unless the disability has been removed
